item.title: Why seaport reforms must begin at the customs house
item.description: The ongoing debate over seaport reforms in Bangladesh is largely centred on the long-term leasing of terminals to foreign operators to modernise port infrastructure.

item.title: The slow death of Test cricket
item.description: In the blink of an eye, the Boxing Day Test was over. For the second time this summer, an Ashes Test concluded in barely two days, with England sealing a four-wicket win at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on December 27, 2025. For many of us, this felt almost unreal.

item.title: Why Bangladesh needs rule-based trade monitoring
item.description: The controversy surrounding under-invoicing surfaced as a flagship achievement of the Bangladesh Bank leadership during the previous regime.
